title: 12 Ways to Impress a Guy on a Date

steps.title: Wear something that you know will catch his eye.
steps.content: Wear something that you know will catch his eye. [1] X Expert Source Judith Gottesman, MSW Matchmaker & Dating Coach Expert Interview. 19 October 2021. That doesn’t necessarily mean you have to show some skin—although that works, too! Just aim to dress up a bit in an outfit or style you know he likes. Wear something that highlights your best features so you’ll feel confident and sexy all night. [2] X Expert Source Judith Gottesman, MSW Matchmaker & Dating Coach Expert Interview. 19 October 2021. For example, if you have bright blue eyes, play them up with a matching blue dress. If you love your curves, highlight them with a pair of fitted trousers or a pencil skirt. If you're proud of your toned arms, wear a top that accentuates them. When he asks you why you’re so dressed up, tell him: “Because I wanted to look my best for you.” Follow that with a smile and he’ll be swooning! If you’ve been together for a while, it’s totally normal to start dressing more casually around each other—and there’s nothing wrong with that. It's fun to change it up sometimes, though!

steps.title: An alluring perfume or cologne will definitely make an impression.
steps.content: An alluring perfume or cologne will definitely make an impression. Our sense of smell is deeply primal, so when he catches a whiff of something intoxicating coming from your skin, he's going to sit up and take notice! Spritz a little perfume or cologne on your wrists and neck right before you walk out the door. Just be sure not to over-spray—ideally, he'll smell the scent when you're within arm's reach. If you aren’t sure what scents your guy likes, try something with notes of lavender, vanilla, or oriental spice. Studies have shown that most men find those smells particularly attractive.

steps.title: Eye contact sends a clear message that you're into him.
steps.content: Eye contact sends a clear message that you're into him. [3] X Expert Source Judith Gottesman, MSW Matchmaker & Dating Coach Expert Interview. 19 October 2021. It may sound too simple to be true, but little things like making eye contact and letting your gaze linger on him can make a big impact. Eye contact can also be very intimate, so this is a super easy way to get your flirt on. [4] X Research source If you're having trouble maintaining eye contact, try this trick: focus on the different colors in his irises. [5] X Research source Try to avoid staring into his eyes nonstop, though! That can be a little intimidating. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Flashing him a genuine smile is effortlessly charming.
steps.content: Flashing him a genuine smile is effortlessly charming. Smiling communicates to him that you're having a great time on your date and you want him to know it. [7] X Expert Source Judith Gottesman, MSW Matchmaker & Dating Coach Expert Interview. 19 October 2021. You'll make him feel special and he'll love your warm demeanor. [8] X Research source If you're feeling extra flirty, throw in a little wink to accompany your smile.

steps.title: Show off your great sense of humor to impress him.
steps.content: Show off your great sense of humor to impress him. Laughter has the same impact as a smile—multiplied tenfold! If you want to make him feel extra special, don't hesitate to giggle when he cracks a joke or makes a humorous comment. He'll love that you appreciate his quick wit. [9] X Research source

steps.title: He'll appreciate these classic flirty gestures.
steps.content: He'll appreciate these classic flirty gestures. Subtle touches on the arm, brushing up against him, and leaning in close when you're chatting are just a few ways to show him that you're attracted to him. Even "accidental" touches can feel intimate; if you're a bit shy, try "accidentally" bumping into him. [10] X Research source If you're sitting next to him, scoot a little closer to him and give him your best smile.

steps.title: A genuine compliment will make him feel appreciated and special.
steps.content: A genuine compliment will make him feel appreciated and special. Who doesn't love a compliment? If possible, try to focus on something that you know is important to him rather than just giving him a generic compliment on his looks. [11] X Research source For example: If he clearly puts effort into his clothes and appearance, you might say, "Are those Tom Ford sunglasses? I thought so! I love that you have such great taste and a sense for fashion." If his work or studies are really important to him, you might say, "Your work ethic and dedication really stand out to me. I think it's super attractive."

steps.title: He'll love that you're genuinely interested in his life.
steps.content: He'll love that you're genuinely interested in his life. [12] X Expert Source Judith Gottesman, MSW Matchmaker & Dating Coach Expert Interview. 19 October 2021. Open-ended questions are questions that can't be answered with a simple "yes" or "no." These questions are perfect when you're on a date because they keep the conversation flowing and help you develop a rapport with your guy. If you can squeeze a little compliment in there, even better! [13] X Research source For example: "I can tell by your adorable accent that you're from the Midwest but I can't pinpoint what state. Where did you grow up and what was it like there?" "I think it's really cool that you work with animals. What's a typical day like at the shelter?"

steps.title: Turn off your phone and have a tech-free evening.
steps.content: Turn off your phone and have a tech-free evening. This may sound like a simple gesture but it’s also really sweet. Tell him that you’re turning off your phone so he knows you plan to focus solely on him. Being the center of your attention is sure to make him feel special. steps.title: Your guy will adore that you’re having such a blast with him.
steps.content: Your guy will adore that you’re having such a blast with him. Flash him plenty of winning smiles and try to keep the conversation light. If the night hits a snag, just try to roll with the punches and focus on having a good time. [15] X Trustworthy Source HelpGuide Nonprofit organization dedicated to providing free, evidence-based mental health and wellness resources. Go to source

steps.title: What if you went to an amusement park instead of the movies?
steps.content: What if you went to an amusement park instead of the movies? If your date activities have been feeling a bit dull lately, spice things up a little! Look for something unique in town that you can do together that you’ve never done before, like going to a carnival, visiting an amusement park, or wine tasting. Think about activities that both of you will really enjoy. Here are a few ideas to consider: Going hiking or camping if you're both nature lovers Dancing the night away at a local club Karaoke night if you both love to sing and/or be silly Sigh up for sky diving lessons if you're adrenaline junkies Taking a pottery or cooking class [16] X Research source

steps.title: He’ll be touched that you went all-out to make him feel special.
steps.content: He’ll be touched that you went all-out to make him feel special. Plan something special and romantic just for him and surprise him with it at the last minute. Just knowing that you put in time and effort to make it a great night will warm his heart. Here are a few ideas to get you started: Plan a midnight picnic on the beach Whisk him away on a day trip Book a spa day or couples massage Pack a few soft blankets and take him stargazing [17] X Research source Reader Poll: We asked 573 wikiHow readers which type of date night they prefer, and 51% of them said spending a cozy night in cuddling and watching a movie.
